name: EventBatch
documentation:
Represents a batch of serialized events for a specific aggregate.

An {@code EventBatch} groups one or more {@link SerializedMessage} instances that belong to the same aggregate. Batches are typically appended atomically to the event store and processed in order.

This class is used within {@link AppendEvents} to persist updates to aggregates in event-sourced systems.

Usage

- All events in a batch must refer to the same aggregate ID. - A batch may be marked as {@code storeOnly} to indicate that the events should not be published to event handlers. @see SerializedMessage @see AppendEvents

fields.name: aggregateId
fields.documentation: The identifier of the aggregate to which these events belong.

fields.name: events
fields.documentation: The list of serialized event messages to be appended.

fields.name: storeOnly
fields.documentation:
Whether the events in this batch should only be stored (not published to consumers).

This can be used to persist events purely for audit purposes or internal replay, without triggering downstream handlers.

methods.name: getBytes
methods.documentation: Calculates the total number of bytes in the data across all messages within the batch.

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: Returns the number of events in this batch.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.documentation: Returns {@code true} if the batch contains no events.

methods.name: toMetric
methods.documentation: Transforms this batch into a lightweight metric representation for logging and monitoring.

methods.name: toString
methods.documentation: Returns a human-readable representation of this batch, including its aggregate ID and event count.
